text: The Atlantic Charter was a statement issued on 14 August 1941. It set out American and British goals for the world after the end of World War II. ==Related pages== * United Nations (UN) * Allies of World War II * Geneva Conventions * European Union (EU) * North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) ==Further reading== ===1940s=== * ===1990s=== * * * * * ===2000s=== * * * * * * * * ===2010s=== * * Jordan, Jonathan W. (2015), American Warlords: How Roosevelt's High Command Led America to Victory in World War II (NAL/Caliber 2015). ==Other websites== * The Atlantic Charter * Secret meetings seal US- Britain alliance, BBC * The Atlantic Conference from the Avalon Project * Letter from The Ambassador Patrick J. Hurley to the US Secretary of State Tehran, 14 April 1945. Describing meeting with Churchill, where Churchill vehemently states that the UK is in no way bound to the principles of the Atlantic Charter. Category:1941 Category:Documents Category:World War II Category:20th century Category:1940s in the United States Category:Politics of the United Kingdom Category:Foreign relations of the United States
title: Atlantic Charter
